org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external

Annotation Type ExportToBlocks


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface ExportToBlocks
    ExportToBlocks indicates that a method is exported to the Blocks programming environment and provides a way for the Java coder to specify some UI attributes of the "call Java method" block. In order for a method to be exported to Blocks, it must:
    • have the ExportToBlocks annotation
    • be public and static
    • not be abstract
    • be in a class in the org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode package

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String comment
      The comment to be used, by default, on the "call Java method" block.
      java.lang.String[] parameterLabels
      The parameter labels to be shown next to each socket on the "call Java method" block.
      java.lang.String tooltip
      The tooltip to be used on the "call Java method" block.

    • Element Detail

      • comment

        public abstract java.lang.String comment
        The comment to be used, by default, on the "call Java method" block. If empty, the block will not have a comment by default.
        Default:
        ""

      • tooltip

        public abstract java.lang.String tooltip
        The tooltip to be used on the "call Java method" block. If empty, a tooltip naming the method, its enclosing class, and its return type will be used.
        Default:
        ""

      • parameterLabels

        public abstract java.lang.String[] parameterLabels
        The parameter labels to be shown next to each socket on the "call Java method" block. If empty, or if the length of the array does not match the method's number of parameters, all sockets will be labeled with the parameter types. If an individual element is empty, the corresponding socket will be labeled with the parameter type. Parameter labels for parameters whose type is LinearOpMode, OpMode, HardwareMap, Telemetry, and Gamepad are ignored as the block does not have sockets corresponding to these parameters. However, an entry must be present in the array here since the length of the array must match the method's number of parameters.
        Default:
        {}
